text: ثم فى سلسلة ذرعها سبعون ذراعا فاسلكوه

translations.translation: Then bind him in a chain which is seventy cubits long.
And string him to a chain seventy cubits long.
then fasten him with a chain, seventy cubits long.
Fasten a chain to them - seventy cubits long -
“Then bind him inside a chain which is seventy arm-lengths.”
Then fasten him on a chain whereof the length is seventy cubits!"
Then thrust him into a chain the length of which is seventy cubits.
then in a chain of seventy cubits' length insert him!
And then insert him in a chain whereof the length is seventy cubits.
Then fasten him with a chain seventy cubits long:
Then, in a chain whereof the length is seventy Cubits, bind him.
Then bind him in a chain, seventy cubits in length.
Further, make him march in a chain, whereof the length is seventy cubits!
Then fasten him with a chain whereof the length is seventy cubits!"
then in a chain seventy arm's lengths long insert him.
Then in a chain which length is seventy cubits tie him up.
Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."

[69:32] then in a chain whose length is seventy cubits — [each cubit being] that of an angel’s forearm — insert him, after admitting him into the Fire (the fā’ [of fa’slukūhu] does not prevent the verb from being semantically   connected to the preceding adverbial clause).

(And then insert him in a chain) insert the chain in his anus and extract it from his mouth, and what remains of it turn it round his neck (whereof the length) and width (is seventy cubits) cubits of the angel; it is also said this means: 70 fathoms.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { ثُمَّ فِي سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعاً } والذراع: سبعون باعاً
 والبَاعُ ما بَينكَ وبينَ مَكة

translations.translation:
And God said: {Then in a chain whose length is seventy cubits} and the cubit is seventy palms.


And the sale between you and Makkah shall be {on the basis of} mutual consent.
